PerformanceMark.summary: PerformanceMark is an interface for objects with an of "mark".

remarks.para: Entries of this type are typically created by calling to add a named (the mark) to the browser's performance timeline. To create a performance mark that isn't added to the browser's performance timeline, use the constructor.

PerformanceMarkPerformanceMark.summary: The PerformanceMark() constructor creates a with the given name.

remarks.para: Unlike , performance marks created by the constructor aren't added to the browser's performance timeline. This means that calls to the interface's getEntries*() methods (, or ) won't show entries for these marks.

PerformanceMarkDetail.summary: The read-only detail property returns arbitrary metadata that was included in the mark upon construction (either when using or the constructor).
PerformanceMarkDetail.value: Returns the value it is set to (from markOptions of or the constructor).
